greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimum number of 9's such that n*[n; 9, ..., 9, n] = [x; ..., x] for some x, where [...] denotes simple continued fractions.
comment: Sequence A213898 lists fixed points of this sequence.
mathematica: f[m_, n_] := Block[{c, k = 1}, c[x_, y_] := ContinuedFraction[x FromContinuedFraction[Join[{x}, Table[m, {y}], {x}]]]; While[First@ c[n, k] != Last@ c[n, k], k++]; k]; f[9, #] & /@ Range[2, 120] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 16 2015 *)
xref: Cf. A000057, A213891 - A213899, A261311: fixed points of the above.
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 15 2015
